Package gg.w6.chesslib.model

Class Position

java.lang.Object
gg.w6.chesslib.model.Position
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Square>
@Immutable public class Position extends Object implements Iterable<Square>
Represents a chess position, including the arrangement of pieces on the board, castling rights, active color, en passant target square, halfmove clock, and fullmove number.

  • Constructor Details

    • Position

      @Internal public Position(@NotNull @NotNull Square[][] squares, @NotNull @NotNull CastlingRights castlingRights, @Nullable @Nullable Coordinate enPassantTargets, @NotNull @NotNull Color toMove, int halfMoveClock, int fullMoves)
      Constructs a Position object with the specified castling rights, en passant target square, active color, halfmove clock, and fullmove number.

      This method should NOT be used. Rather, valueOf(String) or PositionBuilder ought to be used.

      Parameters:
      squares - a file index major 2D array of Square objects.
      castlingRights - the castling rights of the position
      enPassantTargets - the target square for en passant captures, null if there is no en passant target square
      toMove - the color of the player who is to move next
      halfMoveClock - the halfmove clock
      fullMoves - the fullmove number

      Creates a Position object from a FEN string.

      This method is equivalent to FenParser.parse(String)

      Returns:
      a Position object representing the position
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the FEN string is malformed

    • generateFEN

      public String generateFEN()
      Generates the FEN (Forsyth-Edwards Notation) string representing the current board state.

      FEN is a standard notation for describing a particular position of a chess game. It is widely used in chess engines, databases, and communication protocols for encoding board states in a single-line format. FEN strings contain six fields separated by spaces:

      1. Piece placement: Describes the position of each piece on the board, starting from the 8th rank to the 1st rank. Empty squares are represented by digits 1–8 (number of empty squares), and pieces are represented by letters ('P', 'N', 'B', 'R', 'Q', 'K' for white; lowercase for black).
      2. Active color: Indicates which player is to move next, 'w' for white, 'b' for black.
      3. Castling availability: Letters 'KQkq' for white/black kingside/queenside castling rights, or '-' if none are available.
      4. En passant target square: The square that can be captured via en passant, or '-' if not applicable.
      5. Halfmove clock: The number of halfmoves since the last capture or pawn move, used for the 50-move rule.
      6. Fullmove number: The number of the full move, starting at 1 and incremented after each black move.

      Example FEN string for the starting position:

       rnbqkbnr/pppppppp/8/8/8/8/PPPPPPPP/RNBQKBNR w KQkq - 0 1

      For more details, see: FEN on Wikipedia

      Returns:
      A string in FEN format representing the current state of the chess position.

    • applyTo

      public Position applyTo(Move move)
      Applies the given move to this position and returns a new Position representing the resulting board state.

      This method handles all legal move types, including:

      • MoveType.NORMAL – A standard move from one square to another.
      • MoveType.CASTLING – Kingside or queenside castling, including rook movement.
      • MoveType.EN_PASSANT – En passant capture of a pawn.
      • MoveType.PROMOTION – Promotion of a pawn to another piece.

      Castling rights and en passant targets are updated accordingly. The halfmove clock is reset if the move is a capture or a pawn move. The fullmove number is incremented after a move by Black.

      If there is a Pawn double push, the En Passant Target square is set regardless of the legality of an En Passant

      Parameters:
      move - the move to apply
      Returns:
      a new Position reflecting the state of the board after applying the move
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if castling is attempted with an invalid king destination
